turn.0: ELI5: if time is a forth dimension, then is the world just a collection of static 4th dimensional objects?
turn.1: I think when talking about "randomness" It is more practical to ask about predictability.  Its impossible to tell if an event was random or just unpredictable, so I do not think there is much distinction. If its impossible to tell whether a spin left electron will be spin up or spin down, how would it matter if its "truly" random or not, as long as it is indeed "truly" unpredictable.
turn.2: But isn't it just the thing? That quantum physics proved true randomness, something beyond just unpredictable?
turn.3: >That quantum physics proved true randomness, something beyond just unpredictable?  Not quite. Which QM model are you referring to?
turn.4: I'll be honest, I don't understand this topic as much as I'd like to.
turn.5: Well, typically when scientists say random, they just mean unpredictable.
